job_details.Vacaturetitel: Part-time Back End Developer- AI Trainer (Dutch) - Remote
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Outlier helps the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

   We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

   About the opportunity:
     * Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
     * This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you

   You may contribute your expertise by
     * Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
     * Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models, * Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.
job_details.full_text:
Part-time Back End Developer- AI Trainer (Dutch) - Remote

Outlier helps the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

   We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

   About the opportunity:
     * Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
     * This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you

   You may contribute your expertise by
     * Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
     * Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models, * Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on using coding expertise to provide human feedback for training AI models, rather than developing or engineering AI models themselves. It lacks the core responsibilities and technical depth expected of an ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer.

phrases: help train generative artificial intelligence models
Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
job_tasks.justification: These phrases directly relate to the process of training and evaluating AI models, which falls under the 'Modeling' category, even though the role is about providing feedback rather than direct model development.

The description explicitly seeks individuals with software engineering and coding expertise, indicating a need for software development skills, although the application of these skills is for training AI rather than building applications.

soft_skills.justification: The mention of 'discrete, highly variable problems' suggests the need for an ability to tackle varied and potentially complex tasks, aligning with problem-solving skills.

phrases: no requirement for previous AI experience
soft_skills.justification: The statement 'no requirement for previous AI experience' implies that the role values learning and adaptability, as candidates will be trained or expected to learn about AI in the context of the job.
